org.flixel
Class FlxEmitter

java.lang.Object
  org.flixel.FlxPoint
      org.flixel.FlxRect
          org.flixel.FlxObject
              org.flixel.FlxGroup
                  org.flixel.FlxEmitter

public class FlxEmitter
extends FlxGroup

FlxEmitter is a lightweight particle emitter. It can be used for one-time explosions or for continuous fx like rain and fire. FlxEmitter is not optimized or anything; all it does is launch FlxSprite objects out at set intervals by setting their positions and velocities accordingly. It is easy to use and relatively efficient, since it automatically redelays its sprites and/or kills them once they've been launched.

Field Detail

minParticleSpeed

public FlxPoint minParticleSpeed
The minimum possible velocity of a particle. The default value is (-100,-100).

maxParticleSpeed

public FlxPoint maxParticleSpeed
The maximum possible velocity of a particle. The default value is (100,100).

particleDrag

public FlxPoint particleDrag
The X and Y drag component of particles launched from the emitter.

minRotation

public float minRotation
The minimum possible angular velocity of a particle. The default value is -360. NOTE: rotating particles are more expensive to draw than non-rotating ones!

maxRotation

public float maxRotation
The maximum possible angular velocity of a particle. The default value is 360. NOTE: rotating particles are more expensive to draw than non-rotating ones!

gravity

public float gravity
Sets the acceleration.y member of each particle to this value on launch.

on

public boolean on
Determines whether the emitter is currently emitting particles.

delay

public float delay
This variable has different effects depending on what kind of emission it is. During an explosion, delay controls the lifespan of the particles. During normal emission, delay controls the time between particle launches. NOTE: In older builds, polarity (negative numbers) was used to define emitter behavior. THIS IS NO LONGER THE CASE! FlxEmitter.start() controls that now!

quantity

public int quantity
The number of particles to launch at a time.

justEmitted

public boolean justEmitted
Checks whether you already fired a particle this frame.

Method Detail

createSprites

public FlxEmitter createSprites(java.lang.Integer Graphics,
                                int Quantity,
                                int BakedRotations,
                                boolean Multiple,
                                float Collide,
                                float Bounce)
This function generates a new array of sprites to attach to the emitter.

Parameters:
Graphics - If you opted to not pre-configure an array of FlxSprite objects, you can simply pass in a particle image or sprite sheet.
Quantity - The number of particles to generate when using the "create from image" option.
BakedRotations - How many frames of baked rotation to use (boosts performance). Set to zero to not use baked rotations.
Multiple - Whether the image in the Graphics param is a single particle or a bunch of particles (if it's a bunch, they need to be square!).
Collide - Whether the particles should be flagged as not 'dead' (non-colliding particles are higher performance). 0 means no collisions, 0-1 controls scale of particle's bounding box.
Bounce - Whether the particles should bounce after colliding with things. 0 means no bounce, 1 means full reflection.
Returns:
This FlxEmitter instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

createSprites

                                int Quantity,
                                int BakedRotations,
                                boolean Multiple,
                                float Collide)

Parameters:

public void setSize(int Width,

A more compact way of setting the width and height of the emitter.

Parameters:

update

public void update()
Called automatically by the game loop, decides when to launch particles and when to "die".

Overrides:
update in class FlxGroup

start

public void start(boolean Explode,
                  float Delay,
                  int Quantity)
Call this function to start emitting particles.

Parameters:
Explode - Whether the particles should all burst out at once.
Delay - You can set the delay (or lifespan) here if you want.
Quantity - How many particles to launch. Default value is 0, or "all the particles".

                  float Delay)

Parameters:

Delay - You can set the delay (or lifespan) here if you want.

start

public void start()
Call this function to start emitting particles.

emitParticle

public void emitParticle()
This function can be used both internally and externally to emit the next particle.

stop

public void stop(float Delay)
Call this function to stop the emitter without killing it.

Parameters:
Delay - How long to wait before killing all the particles. Set to 'zero' to never kill them.

stop

public void stop()
Call this function to stop the emitter without killing it.

at

public void at(FlxObject Object)
Change the emitter's position to the origin of a FlxObject.

Parameters:
Object - The FlxObject that needs to spew particles.

kill

public void kill()
Call this function to turn off all the particles and the emitter.
